Ask HN: Roadmap to Becoming an AI Engineer
text:
I'm in university studying CS. GPT and other developments in AI amaze me and I've been digging really deep into how it works and trying to tinker away at personal projects using it. I've been taking classes in AI and really think that I want to pursue internships/research further in the field.

I get that there's a fundamental difference between ML/AI researchers and engineers, but I'd really love to be working in this domain once I graduate in 2 years.

If you had to give a multi-year long roadmap to becoming an ML/AI Engineer, what would it look like? Are there any online courses/textbooks/university classes in particular you'd recommend to take?

Show HN: MasterPlan – A complete audio mastering workflow in a plugin
text:
Hi HN, I'm Sam! Long time reader here who finally left a desk job in embedded systems a few years ago to start my own company (Musik Hack) as the technical chops, with my co-founder Stan coming from the music business. It's been really inspiring to read so many stories here, so I'm proud to be going through the motions myself!

I'm sharing our first product, Master Plan, an audio plugin for mastering music. We took all the stuff required to turn a decent mix into a major-label quality release and jammed it into one easy-to-digest tool. Then we amped it up with a very special loudness circuit that outperforms some industry standbys and competitors in listening tests. I'm very excited to share and hear what you think, especially if you've got an opinion about how our loudness circuit is doing compared to whatever you're currently using.

MasterPlan runs as a VST, AU, or AAX audio plugin on Mac (Intel/Apple Silicon) and Windows. It does require an email address to use, but that's it (no password, 2 factor, or otherwise).

----

PS: If you haven't heard of "mastering," but got this far anyway, it most obviously increases perceived loudness. It also brings out the most pleasing bits of whatever material it started with (like salt does to food). Mastering also helps your track sound good on all sorts of devices, whether they fit in your ear or hang above a stage. Anyway, you've probably seen the word at least once in the phrase "Remixed and Remastered," so now you know!

PSA: Always specify the LLM model
text:
There are many comments here on HN (and elsewhere) where people talk about "ChatGPT" or "GPT" without specifying whether it's GPT-3.5 or GPT-4 (or others even). Then other people point that out and say that if they haven't tried GPT-4 yet, they should.

And there are likely many more where it's not explicit, but a discussion is still taking place between someone who's only used 3.5 and someone who's used 4, and they're disagreeing about capabilities.

And there are other LLM models out there, so "LLMs" is non-specific, which can sometimes cause imprecision or confusion in a discussion.

So it would be great if people who haven't tried GPT-4 yet and are willing and able to do so, did so. And if you haven't, don't want to, or can't, then provide that clarification in the discussion.

In addition, it would help if everyone stopped only saying "ChatGPT" and started saying "GPT-3.5" and "GPT-4". (And yes, there's 3.5 vs. 3.5-turbo, but I don't want to ask for too much.) ChatGPT is mostly a frontend to the models. Of course if that's what you're talking about, or about the customization OpenAI might have made to the models used by ChatGPT, that's fine.

Let's elevate the discussion around this topic together!

Show HN: Cadseer. a parametric solid modeling CAD desktop application
text:
Cadseer is in the same genre as: solidworks, inventor, freecad etc... Cadseer is alpha software, so lots of missing features, bugs, crashes, file incompatibilities etc...

About me: I spent 15 years designing stamping dies on a high end cad system. During that time, I also developed and marketed extensions/plugins toward that cad system. Through that experience, I came disillusioned with 'vendor lock-in' and proprietary software in general. I basically retired, took the vow of poverty and moved all my computing to open source. I have since, and continue to, try and improve the open source cad environment.

Is YC SAFE valuation cap same as valuation?
text:
I am raising $100K to build a product, and then run some GTM strategies (that worked previously). Got 120+ paid users (mostly presales) and around 16K in revenue (~10 months).

Now whenever I am talking to early-stage investors, mostly angels, they are asking - how much in % will I get?

I am trying my best to explain, we are an early-stage company and don't have a valuation. However, we are open to setting up a valuation cap.

The conversation gets difficult at this point. Let's say I am asking for a $1M valuation cap and they are instantly getting confused/furious how is your valuation $1M with $1.6K MRR only?

How to get around this?

How to Defeat Scalper Bots?
text:
This morning, my friends and I attempted to buy boygenius tickets at Red Rocks through AXS during the general sale after failing to get them at the presale two days earlier.

With three people on multiple devices in line, one of use was sure to secure tickets right?

Nope — we were stuck waiting in the queue until all the tickets had sold out. Immediately they went on resale on AXS and stubhub.

I know this isn't a new problem, but it is deeply frustrating. And I am curious, what ideas people have to mitigate or fix this at the different levels (individual, artist, ticket seller)?
